Problem:
Consider a system governed by a partial differential equation \\(\\frac{\\partial u}{\\partial t} = Lu + p(x,t)\\), where L is a linear differential operator and p(x,t) is a source function. We will investigate the influence of a Fourier transform, defined by \\( \\hat{f}(k,t) = \\int_{-\\infty}^\\infty e^{-ikx} f(x,t) dx \\), applied to the source function p(x,t).

Can we accurately deduce the initial condition p(x,0) after observing u(x,T) without knowing whether the Fourier transform \\( \\hat{p}(k,t) \\) was applied?
Explanation: Without knowledge of the application of \\( \\hat{p}(k,t) \\), it is not possible to reverse-engineer the exact initial condition p(x,0) due to potential changes in the source function's frequency components, which are not directly observable from u(x,T) alone.
